subject: Re: [junit] Problem with Method which is expected to throw message
msgSnippet: What compilation errors do you get if you uncomment those lines? David
messageBody:
What compilation errors do you get if you uncomment those lines?

David

On Wed, Jun 9, 2010 at 8:58 AM, raja_s_patil <kpr.rspatil@...> wrote:
> Hello,
>
> I am using junit 4 for first time and new to java too.
>
> I am trying to do unit testing a class which has a method
> which is suppose to throw a exception. I have instantiated
> the class and tried method with valid values and test passed
> but I will also like to test invalid data and it should raise
> exception then test should pass. the testCase is as below.
>
> If i comment out try..catch block I am getting compilation errors.
>
> I am using Spring toolsuit 2.3.2 to run the test and Junit 4
>
> Thanks and regards
>
> Raja.
>
> public class testBoolTypeHandler extends MockObjectTestCase {
>
>        private ResultGetter            getter;
>        private ParameterSetter         setter;
>        private boolTypeHandlerTF       boolHandler;
>
>        @Before
>        public void setUp() throws Exception {
>
>                getter          = mock(ResultGetter.class);
>                setter          = mock(ParameterSetter.class);
>                boolHandler     = new boolTypeHandlerTF();
>
>                checking(new Expectations() {
>                        {
>                                atLeast(1).of(getter).getString();
>                                will(onConsecutiveCalls(returnValue("T"), returnValue("F"), returnValue(" ")    // , returnValue('F')
>                                        ));
>                                }
>                        });
>                }
>
>        @After
>        public void tearDown() throws Exception {}
>
>        @Test(expected = java.sql.SQLException.class)
>        public void testGetResult() {
>
>                Boolean result;
>
> //      try {
>                result  = (Boolean) (boolHandler.getResult(getter));
>                assertEquals("Should Return True", true, result.booleanValue());
>
>                result  = (Boolean) (boolHandler.getResult(getter));
>                assertEquals("Should Return False", false, result.booleanValue());
>
>                result  = (Boolean) (boolHandler.getResult(getter));
>
> //      }
> //      catch (Exception e) {
> //      e.printStackTrace();
> //      fail("Exception Raised");
> //      }
>                }
>
>        /**
>         * @Test
>         * public void testSetParameter() {
>         *   fail("Not yet implemented");
>         * }
>         *
>         * @Test
>         * public void testValueOf() {
>         *   fail("Not yet implemented");
>         * }
>         */
>        }
>
>
